title._content: “Home of a Rebel Sharpshooter” has become an iconic representation of war. Both photos of the sharpshooter appear in "Gardner's Photographic Sketch Book of the War" (1866), but under different titles (LOC)

description._content: Gardner, Alexander,, 1821-1882,, photographer. Home of a rebel sharpshooter 1863 July, c1866. 1 photographic print : albumen. Notes: Illus. in: Gardner's photographic sketch book of the war / Alexander Gardner. Washington, D.C. : Philp & Solomons, [c1866], v. 1, no. 41. Copyright by A. Gardner. Original neg: LC-B817- 7942. Title from item. Photograph showing a dead Confederate soldier and his gun. Subjects: War casualties--Pennsylvania--Gettysburg--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Casualties. Format: Book illustrations--1860-1870. Albumen prints--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.12562 Call Number: Illus. in E468.7 .G2, v. 1, no. 41
